title-group.article-title: The Circle of Inclusion: Sustainability, CSR and the Values that Drive Them

contrib-group.aff: Kerul Kassel, PhD, Fielding Graduate University, 3323 Schoolhouse Road, Harmony, FL, USA 34773 6008. E-mail: kkassel@fielding.edu

abstract.p: This article examines the values that underlie notions of sustainability and corporate social responsibility, and how those values influence perspectives on who and what is included in decision-making. The author argues that the epistemologies of economic considerations in industrial practices, and how they are framed by science and technology, make it unlikely that practices towards sustainability will successfully avert expanding global crises unless the circle of inclusion is expanded to include other-than-human life.
